page.title: 18Archeological Remains
page.content: In the north east corner of the block there are stone rows, hut circles and stone circles, evidence of early man having lived in this area. Further antiquities are a kist-vaen, standing stones, and stone crosses. The stone rows run side by side at Merrivale, one being about 850 feet and the other 600 feet long in an east-west direction. The kist-vaen is close by the southern row and has unfortunately been damaged, but it still retains most of its original stone construction. The biggest standing stone is about 10 feet. Crosses are numerous on Dartmoor and are thought to be associated with ancient markers for tracks such as the Abbot's Way from Plympton to Tavistock.
